GL.iNet offers a diverse lineup of routers designed for different use cases ranging from powerful home networking to portable travel solutions.

This short posts discusses the differences between the Flint 2, Slate AX, Brume AX, Slate 7, and Flint 3.

üîç Comparison & Contrast

Performance

  • Flint 2 & Flint 3: Heavy-duty home/office routers. Flint 3 is more advanced with Wi-Fi 7 tri-band and higher throughput.
  • Slate AX & Slate 7: Portable travel routers. Slate 7 is future-proof with Wi-Fi 7.
  • Brume AX: Unique as a wired VPN gateway without Wi-Fi.

VPN Speeds

  • Flint 2 leads with 900 Mbps WireGuard.
  • Flint 3 balances across protocols with 680 Mbps.
  • Slate AX & Slate 7 provide solid mid-range VPN speeds for travel.
  • Brume AX is slower but optimized for secure remote access.

Ports

  • Flint 3 dominates with five 2.5G ports.
  • Flint 2 offers dual 2.5G + 4 Gigabit.
  • Slate 7 has dual 2.5G ports, impressive for a travel router.
  • Slate AX & Brume AX stick to Gigabit ports.

Use Cases

  • Flint 2 & Flint 3 ‚Üí Home/office, gaming, streaming, multi-device environments.
  • Slate AX & Slate 7 ‚Üí Travel, portable secure internet, hotel/public Wi-Fi.
  • Brume AX ‚Üí VPN gateway for remote workers or small businesses.

‚úÖ Summary

  • Flint 3 ‚Üí Best choice for cutting-edge Wi-Fi 7 tri-band performance.
  • Flint 2 ‚Üí Excellent Wi-Fi 6 home router with top VPN speeds.
  • Slate AX & Slate 7 ‚Üí Ideal for travel, with Slate 7 offering Wi-Fi 7 future-proofing.
  • Brume AX ‚Üí Perfect for a dedicated VPN gateway without Wi-Fi.
